feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding, with the worst conditions expected from the Kenai Lake to Funny River. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Wednesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:27PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila and Pinal Counties through 715 PM MST... At 627 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Cutter, or 12 miles northeast of Christmas. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:25PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Yavapai County through 700 PM MST... At 624 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Yarnell to 11 miles south of Wagoner to near Castle Hot Springs. Movement was southwest at 15 mph towards Wickenburg.
